page.title: 02A SHORT HISTORY_SKELMERSDALE
page.content:
by G.Cooke ,A.McManus and C.Gray.
Skelmersdale,now one of Britain's larger New Towns,was once part of a powerful Anglo-Saxon kingdom.In the 10th.Century hordes of Vikings settled in N.W.England and some of these made Skelmersdale their home.The name "Skelmersdale"comes from the old Scandinavian language.The name means"the valley of Skjaldmar"-this being the name of a Viking warrior.
Skelmersdale even got a mention in the original Domesday Book.The area was thinly populated and with a few patches of cultivated land.
In the latter part of the 19th. and the early 20th.century Skelmersdale became a fairly prosperous coal-mining centre.
